properties.areaDesc: Swains Island; Tutuila and Aunuu; Manua
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 6:46PM SBT by NWS Pago Pago AS
properties.description:
Strengthening tropical activity in the region will generate an
extended period of strong and gusty winds, heavy rainfall, increased
dangerous surf and coastal hazards this weekend across American
Samoa. Trends suggest that these hazardous weather conditions will
likely continue into next week.

The strong winds will have the potential to blow down trees, down
power lines, blow around loose objects, damage roofs and small
out-buildings and outdoor kitchen. Additionally, travel becomes
more difficult during high wind events, especially for high profile
vehicles.

Frequent periods of heavy rainfall will increase the risk for
flash flooding, flooded roadways, overflowing streams, and landslides
into early next week.

We expect hazardous seas which will create high surf conditions
along with gale force winds along American Samoa coastal waters.
These conditions will be hazardous to small crafts, due to strong
rip currents which may capsize or damage vessels.

American Samoa is in the middle of hurricane season. It is important
to actively listen for the latest updates from your National Weather
Service and TEMCO. You may also contact EOC at 699-3800 for more
precautionary and preparedness actions. Please visit our website
at weather.gov/ppg and follow us on Facebook @NWSPagoPago

NWSheadline: Damaging weather conditions threaten American Samoa
